fields.description:
Also here:

https://www.ag-grid.com/forum/showthread.php?tid=6337

User wants to do some final sorting after the grid has done the sorting.

So can do:
colDef.postSort(nodeList)
that takes the list of nodes and then do some final sorting on it, eg keep one row always at the top.

could then be applied to the whole grid by applying to all columns via the defaultColDef
fields.summary: Allow having a callback to refine the sort of the rows after the grid sorts them.

fields.description:
if you double click group expand, you get 'open' (click 1), 'close' (click 2), 'open' (double click).

so i've put logic in, if you double click the expand icon, it doesn't do the double click, ie it just opens, and then closes.
fields.summary: double clicking 'column group expand' icon gives bad results

fields.description:
I dont believe the external window bit is necessarily important, but its mentioned as its part of this repo.

See attached example on zendesk - follow these steps:

1.click open window 
2.add a row from the external window. 
3.close the external window 
4.ungroup

Does not occur in Chrome

https://plnkr.co/edit/MxWmzGJUeCQqXdpNFnfV?p=info

fields.description:
To recreate:

1) Edit main demo, set 'applyButton=true' for country filter.
2) Open main demo, open up country filter and change it but to NOT hit apply.
3) Go to console and enter "gridOptions.api.getFilterModel();"

Expected: No filter should be returned (as 'Apply' not pressed)
Actual: The intermediate filter state is returned.
fields.summary: getFilterModel() returns intermediate state when 'Apply Button' is used

fields.description:
Right now we just check for chrome. See github issue. 


Even though this was an on purpose design choice. 

From the docs at 13.3.0...

By default the grid will use the browser provided date picker for Chrome (as we think it's nice), but for all other browser it will just provide a simple text field. You can provide your chosen date picker to ag-Grid. This is done by providing a custom Date Component via the grid property dateComponent as follows:
fields.summary: Allow forcing type date for the column no matter what browser
